meanings.sent1: Tom tried to dup his friend into believing a fake story.
meanings.sent2: She was duped into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to dup the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist managed to dup many unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The spy's mission was to dup the enemy into revealing their secrets.

meanings.definition: To make a duplicate copy of something.
meanings.sent1: Please dup this document for our records.
meanings.sent2: The student forgot to dup his assignment before turning it in.
meanings.sent3: The office assistant needed to dup the important files for backup.
meanings.sent4: The photographer will dup the photos for the clients to keep.
meanings.sent5: It is essential to dup important documents to prevent loss.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or tricked.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a dup and fall for their lies.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a dup in the con game.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a character who was always the dup in funny situations.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a dup after realizing he had been fooled by the scam.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a cunning dup who manipulated others for personal gain.
